title: Looking for ANY design videos/DVDs
content:
I teach a History of Visual Communication and Design class at a community college. I have struck out finding any decent videos or dvds pertaining to design. I have found Duchamp, Mondrian, man Ray vids but I am looking for more relevant 20th C designers and design movements. I would love to find anything on Constructivism, de Stijl, Bauhaus, Modernism, Swiss school. Anybody have anything you could point me to?

 [‹ akzidenz grotesk - looking for a match](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075811/http:/typophile.com/node/16203 "Go to previous forum topic") [Gangster Font? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075811/http:/typophile.com/node/16207 "Go to next forum topic")

Hillman Curtis has produced some excellent short films/videos on various designers called, appropriately enough, The Designer Series. I don’t know if they are available on DVD or not though. It would be nice if they were. I really enjoyed watching all of them, and they include some very well known designers - Sagmeister, Carson, Pentagram (Scher, Beirut), etc. You can watch them at:  
 [http://www.hillmancurtis.com/hc\_web/film\_video.shtml](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075811/http:/www.hillmancurtis.com/hc_web/film_video.shtml "http://www.hillmancurtis.com/hc\_web/film\_video.shtml")

I wrote up a pretty extensive post on my blog about the [available graphic design documentaries](http://web.archive.org/web/20071022075811/http:/www.graphicdefine.org/documentaries-on-graphic-design/) out there. Enjoy!
